name: Things That Changed the World Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which African anti-apartheid leader was released from jail in 1990, after more than 27 years?
questions.explanation:
Nelson Mandela.

	Mandela was jailed for more than 27 years during white rule in South Africa.  This began the equality of South Africa's people.

questions.text: In 1998, which drug was designed to treat angina, but was found also to reverse the impotency in men?
questions.explanation:
Viagra.

	Viagra, designed by Pfizer Laboratories, was FDA approved on March 7, 1998.

questions.text: The Beatles appeared in the U.S. in 1964, on which nationwide television show?
questions.explanation:
The Ed Sullivan Show.

	The really big show aired the Beatles' first live TV appearance on February 9, 1964.  The group from Liverpool shaped the remainder of the 1960s and 1970s music scene.

questions.text: Who was the star in the 1928 theater showing of "Steamboat Willie"?
questions.explanation:
Mickey Mouse.

	Walt Disney, an unknown at the time, combined sounds with a newly animated cartoon character.  This changed the world when it opened in New York.  Disney was 27 years old at the time.

questions.text: How many on-site workers were killed at the Pentagon as a result of the 2001 terrorist attack?
questions.explanation:
184.

	With the infamous date of 9-11, the world saw that America was as vulnerable to terrorism as any other country in the world.

questions.text: Which of the following was killed on November 22, 1963?
questions.explanation:
John F. Kennedy

	Allegedly killed by Lee Harvey Oswald in a still controversial subject, the assassination of President Kennedy opened the doors to the Vietnam War.  The world still wonders what might have been, or what might not have been.

questions.text: Which of the following died on November 24, 1989?
questions.explanation:
Sheik Abdullah Azzam.

	At the age of only 48, he was the most prominent advocate of the jihad to "save Muslim lands from infidel encroachment".  He was killed by a land mine in Pakistan.  His deputy took over the #1 spot.  His name was Osama bin Laden.

questions.text: What was the name of the aircraft that dropped the atom bomb on Hiroshima?
questions.explanation:
Enola Gay.

	On August 6, 1945, it dropped the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima, killing one-third of the city's 350,000 people.  It introduced a new dread into the world.

questions.text: Who was the first black player to break the color barrier into Major League baseball?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Robinson.

	Determined to break the segregation in baseball, Branch Rickey signed this former UCLA star in 1947 to the Brooklyn Dodgers.  Robinson returned the favor by winning the Rookie of the Year Award, and then winning the Most Valuable Player Award in 1949.  Larry Doby was the first American League black player.  Doby died in 2003.

questions.text: What world-changing event happened on May 9, 1960?
options: The first manned flight into space
The National Rifle Association was formed
Jimmy Hoffa created the first workers union
questions.explanation:
Birth control pills were introduced.

	Enovid was approved by the FDA.  It marked the beginning for a new era of sexuality, and intercourse without pregnancy was now possible.  This was the beginning to planned parenthood.
